item.title: The Epistemology of Computation
item.description: Sense data, or experience A priori knowledge or instincts Locke thought there were three: intuitive, demonstrative, and sensitive, although he may have been kidding about demonstrative. Critical mass example. You can know the all the relevant theory, you can have the data and measurements in front of you. You even know the exact steps you will take to carry out the calculations, to the extent that you could delegate that task to a fairly simple machine if you wanted to.
